abstract.p: Francis Megahy letter disputes assertion by Yasmin Alibhai-Brown in June 25 article that London is becoming more culturally diverse (S)

block.p: Yasmin Alibhai-Brown [''A Magic Carpet of Cultures in London,'' June 25] thinks that ''London is becoming the keeper of precious diversity.'' In fact, if the cultural dominance she promotes of ethnic minorities in the arts there actually existed, it would be something quite different: simply another example of the way Britain is dominated by elites. The ethnic minority population of Britain totals under 6 percent.

In fact, if the cultural dominance she promotes of ethnic minorities in the arts there actually existed, it would be something quite different: simply another example of the way Britain is dominated by elites. The ethnic minority population of Britain totals under 6 percent.

Ms. Alibhai-Brown's article contains such statements as, ''New Labour is still too white in its inner sanctums''; ''Chefs at modern Indian restaurants have completely outwitted their complacent (and often arrogant and careless) counterparts at French and Italian restaurants''; '' 'Young London is black London' ''; young blacks and Asians ''have styled their way into British culture -- which is not hard because it was very unstylish.'' Wow! Imagine these sentiments racially reversed, and I think we'd immediately see them for what they are: outrageous bigotry.
